H0.text: Digestive is the system in which foodborne illness, food allergies, or a food intolerance cause symptoms.

H1.text: Respiratory is the system in which foodborne illness, food allergies, or a food intolerance cause symptoms.

H2.text: Circulatory is the system in which foodborne illness, food allergies, or a food intolerance cause symptoms.

H3.text: Skeletal is the system that foodborne illness, food allergies, or a food intolerance cause symptoms in.

A4.text: They may include itchiness, swelling of the tongue, vomiting, diarrhea, hives, trouble breathing, or low blood pressure.

A5.text: Respiratory tract symptoms can include nasal congestion, sinusitis, pharyngeal irritations, asthma and an unproductive cough.

A6.text: GIT symptoms include mouth ulcers, abdominal cramp, nausea, gas, intermittent diarrhea, constipation, irritable bowel syndrome (IBS), and may include anaphylaxis.

A7.text: They often include vomiting, fever, aches, and diarrhea.
